story_chapters.title: The Birth of Lam-Ang
story_chapters.description: Learn about the miraculous birth and early life of Lam-Ang
story_chapters.content: Lam-Ang was an extraordinary child born to Don Juan and Namongan. Even before birth, he could speak and chose his own name. After his father disappeared, young Lam-Ang set out to find him.
educational_points: Lam-Ang possessed supernatural abilities from birth
The epic showcases Ilocano values of family and bravery
The story reflects pre-colonial Filipino culture

quiz.question: What made Lam-Ang special from birth?
options: He could speak before being born
quiz.explanation: Lam-Ang was extraordinary because he could speak even before birth and chose his own name.

story_chapters.title: The Quest for Don Juan
story_chapters.description: Follow Lam-Ang on his journey to avenge his father
story_chapters.content: As Lam-Ang grew, he learned that his father Don Juan had been killed by the Igorot tribe. With his supernatural strength and loyal companions - his rooster and dog - he set out to avenge his father's death.
educational_points: Shows the importance of filial duty in Ilocano culture
Illustrates the role of animal companions in epic literature

quiz.question: Who were Lam-Ang's loyal companions?
quiz.explanation: Lam-Ang's faithful companions were his magical rooster and dog who helped him on his adventures.

story_chapters.title: The Courtship of Ines Kannoyan
story_chapters.description: Witness Lam-Ang's pursuit of his true love
story_chapters.content: After avenging his father, Lam-Ang fell in love with the beautiful Ines Kannoyan. To win her hand, he had to compete with many suitors and demonstrate his exceptional abilities. His supernatural powers and charm eventually won her heart.
educational_points: Reflects traditional courtship practices in Ilocano society
Shows the value of perseverance in achieving goals
Highlights gender roles in pre-colonial Philippines

quiz.question: Who did Lam-Ang wish to marry?
quiz.explanation: Lam-Ang fell in love with and married the beautiful Ines Kannoyan after proving his worth.

story_chapters.title: The Great Trial
story_chapters.content: To prove himself worthy of Ines Kannoyan, Lam-Ang had to complete several impossible tasks. He showed his strength by defeating numerous enemies and his intelligence by solving difficult riddles. His rooster's crow could destroy buildings and his dog's bark could bring them back.
educational_points: Supernatural elements symbolize exceptional human qualities
Tests and trials are common in hero epics
The story teaches about inner strength and character

quiz.question: What special power did Lam-Ang's rooster have?
quiz.explanation: Lam-Ang's magical rooster had a crow so powerful it could destroy buildings.

story_chapters.title: Death and Resurrection
story_chapters.content: While diving for fish to please his wife, Lam-Ang was swallowed by a giant fish called Berkakan and died. However, with the help of his rooster and dog, and the power of his bones, he was miraculously brought back to life. This resurrection symbolizes the triumph of good over evil.
educational_points: Death and rebirth themes in Philippine mythology
The power of love and loyalty to overcome death
Represents the cycle of life in Filipino beliefs

quiz.question: How was Lam-Ang brought back to life?
options: By his rooster and dog retrieving his bones
quiz.explanation: Lam-Ang's loyal rooster and dog retrieved his bones from the fish, and through their help, he was resurrected.

characters.name: Lam-Ang
characters.description: The legendary hero with supernatural powers, brave and loyal

characters.name: Ines Kannoyan
characters.description: Beautiful and virtuous woman who became Lam-Ang's wife

enemies.name: Berkakan
enemies.description: Giant fish monster of the deep
